title: Fan - Depicting the Coronation of Louis XVI
medium: silk, mother-of-pearl, gouache, gold and silver leaf, silk and metalic thread
provenance_text:
Brayton C. Ives [1840-1914], New York, NY, until October 22, 1914 [1]; Estate of Brayton C. Ives, October 22, 1914 until April 1915; (sold at American Art Association, New York, NY, April 9, 1915) [2]; purchased by Herbert DuPuy [1856-1930], Pittsburgh, PA, April 9, 1915; gift to Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, November 1927. 
NOTES: [1] Documentation from Herbert DuPuy states that Ives purchased this fan for $750, but does not record where or when he purchased it. [2] Lot 226.
